meanings.definition: A person who pretends to be someone else in order to deceive others.
meanings.sent1: The imposters tried to steal money by pretending to be bank employees.
meanings.sent2: The police caught the imposters who were posing as doctors at the hospital.
meanings.sent3: The imposters at the costume party were so convincing that no one recognized them.
meanings.sent4: The imposters in the play were so skilled that the audience believed they were the real characters.
meanings.sent5: Beware of imposters who may try to trick you into giving away your personal information.

meanings.definition: Something that is not what it purports to be; a fraud or sham.
meanings.sent1: The expensive watch turned out to be an imposter, just a cheap replica.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase was revealed to be an imposter when it was found to be a modern copy.
meanings.sent3: The imposter painting fooled art experts until they discovered it was a clever forgery.
meanings.sent4: The imposter prince was unmasked when his true identity was revealed to the royal court.
meanings.sent5: The imposter diamond sparkled with deceit, fooling even the most experienced gem appraisers.
